result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:02 AM Defendant Noah Wesley Garland in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Information is filed.Court reads charges and possible penalties Defendant waives further reading.  Defendant pleas not guilty to all count. Court enters
Arraignment on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:17 PM Defendant Noah Wesley Garland appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court.  DA Halle Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Helgeson requests bond modification, DA Hatch does not object to Court hearing argument today but does object to bond modification.  Atty. Helgeson states argument and requests signature bond.  DA Hatch objects, notes bond just set last week by Judge Rohl and states argument.  Court denies bond modification request, cash bond remains with conditions.  Adjourned at 2:25 PM

02:07 PM Defendant Noah Wesley Garland appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court.  DA Halle Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  S/T RFPD Officer Alex Sather.  Direct by DA Hatch.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Helgeson.  Officer released.  State makes argument, requests probable cause.  Atty. Helgeson declines argument.  Court makes finding; finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
